subtitle: Chapter five fourth pillar system system
is that principle of order by which
confusion is rendered impossible in the
natural and universal order everything
is in its place so that the vast
universe runs more perfectly than the
most perfect machine disorder in space
would mean the destruction of the
universe and disorder and a man's
affairs destroys his work and his
prosperity all complex organizations are
built up by system no business or
society can develop into larger
dimensions apart from system and this
principle is pre-eminently the
instrument of the merchant the
businessman and the organizer of
institutions there are many departments
in which a disorderly man may succeed
although attention to order would
increase his success but he will not
succeed in business unless he can place
the business entirely in the hands of a
systemic manager who will thereby remedy
his own defect all large business
concerns have been evolved along
definitely drawn systemic lines any

to the efficiency and welfare of the
business complex business or other
organizations are built up like complex
bodies in nature by scrupulous attention
to detail the disorderly man thinks he
can be careless about everything but the
main end but by ignoring the means he
frustrates the end by the disarrangement
of details organisms perish and by the
carelessness of details the growth of
any work or concern is prevented

amount of time and energy the time
frittered away and hunting for things is
sufficient worth conserved by order to
enable them to achieve any success for
slovenly people never have a place for

require in the irritation bad hue
Maran chagrin which this daily hunting
for things brings about as much energy
is dissipated as would be required to
build up a big business or scale the
highest heights of achievement in any
direction orderly people can serve both
their time and energy they never lose

find anything everything is in its place
and the hand can be a once placed upon
it though it be in the dark they can
well afford to be cool and deliberate
and so use their mental energies in
something more profitable than
irritation bad temper and accusing
others for their lack order there is a
kind of genius and system which can

systematic man can get through so great
a quantity of work in such a short time
and with such freedom from such
exhaustion as to appear almost
miraculous he scales the height of
success while his slovenly competitor is

law of order enables him to reach his
ends swiftly and smoothly without
friction or loss of time the demands of
system in all departments of the
business world are as rigid and exacting
as the holy vows of a saint and cannot
be violated in the smallest particular
but at the risk of one's financial
prospects in the financial world the law
of order is an iron necessity and he who
faultlessly observes it saves time
temper and money every enduring
achievement in human society rests upon
a basis of system so true is this that
were systems withdrawn progress would
cease think for instance of the vast

the great poems the innumerable prose
works the monumental histories the
soul-stirring orations
think also of the social intercourse of
human society
of its religions it's legal statutes and

comprehensiveness is that quality of
